unittitle.value: Joan Roelofs Collection on the Green Movement

abstract.value: Joan Roelofs was Professor of Political Science at Keene State College from 1979 until 2012 specializing in green public adminsitration, the political power of foundations and the ideas of pre-Marxist socialist Charles Fourier. She is the author of <title render="italic">Greening Cities: Building Just</title>, <title render="italic">Sustainable Communities</title>, and <title render="italic">Foundations and Public Policy</title>. She is also a practitioner of book arts. This collection consists of various papers, articles, notes and fliers regarding the environment, labor issues and the socio-political situation in America during the late-20th century; as well as issues of numerous publications examining contemporary issues in climate change, environmental politics, and energy policy and development.

p.value: Identification of item, date; Joan Roelofs Collection on the Green Movement; TAM 651; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Donated by Joan Roelofs in 2014. The accession number associated with this gift is 2014.149.

Joan Roelofs was Professor of Political Science at Keene State College from 1979 until 2012 specializing in green public adminsitration, the political power of foundations and the ideas of pre-Marxist socialist Charles Fourier. She is the author of <title render="italic">Greening Cities: Building Just</title>, <title render="italic">Sustainable Communities</title>, and <title render="italic">Foundations and Public Policy</title>. She is also a practitioner of book arts.

This collection consists of various papers, articles, notes and flyers regarding the environment, labor issues and the socio-political situation in America during the late-20th century; as well as issues of numerous publications examining contemporary issues in climate change, environmental politics, and energy policy and development. The collection includes multiple issues of <title render="italic">Green Politics</title> and <title render="italic">Synthesis/Regeneration</title>.
